physical_examinations.vital_signs: Blood pressure was slightly elevated (140/80). Blood urea nitrogen was abnormally high (55 mg/dl), as was serum creatinine (5.1 mg/dl). Urinalysis detected marked proteinuria (6 g protein/24 hours), and the glomerular filtration rate was 20 ml/min (normal; 120 ml/min).
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Right eye had questionable response to light; left eye followed optokinetic stimulus well. Bilateral symmetric horizontal pendular nystagmus noted. The right eye showed a Mittendorf dot and absence of central vessels, with a low serous retinal detachment. Similar findings were noted in the left eye, with an excavated disc and absent peripheral retinal vessels.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Intravenous fluorescein angiography at 5 months revealed bilateral absence of peripheral retinal vessels and slow, segmental retinal/choroidal filling indicating a significant ocular vascular abnormality progression.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Renal ultrasound at 8 months confirmed small kidneys (right, 3.8 cm; left, 4.1 cm; normal 5-6 cm) with diffuse increased echogenicity of the renal cortex.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Magnetic resonance imaging revealed normal-sized globes with attenuated optic nerves; small optic tracts; and near-absence of the optic chiasm. Doppler showed absence of central retinal vasculature bilaterally.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Progression to renal ultrasonography at this age showed small kidneys previously noted with hypoplastic characteristics.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Doppler ultrasonography indicated high-resistance arterial flow in both main renal arteries with no blood flow detectable during diastole, consistent with renal dysplasia.
